description: From Middle English *leftal, *lieftele, from Old English lēoftǣl, lēoftǣle (“kind, lovable, loving, dear, grateful, agreeable”), equivalent to lief +‎ tell.

adjectives.description: leeftail (comparative more leeftail, superlative most leeftail)

entries.meaning: (UK dialectal, obsolete) High in demand; quickly sold.
examples: Markets hes been terrable laa this lang time, hardly worth gangin teea; but it wur Size, en wur a varra lieftel market, an et wur a wunder.
